pros: The opportunity to work with students from around the world was enlightening and the opportunity to interact with other instructors was great for networking and sharing resources.
cons: Kendall was bought first by Laureate Education and then merged with another college.

pros: I enjoyed doing what I was doing.
cons: bureaucracy and not forward thinking

pros: Not a good salary to be too busy
cons: I don’t have any idea

pros: Kendall has some great people, awesome students and unique perks, like 3 delicious meals a day made by our students for a minimal monthly cost (like, really cheap!). Theres also a great parking perk and tuition reduction rates. Although not many dev opportunities were presented to all staff, I was involved in many and they were quite useful. Theres been improvement, though.
cons: Although my compensation was to market, I felt the annual merit increases could have been meatier. Kendall is owned by Laureate, which causes barriers in terms of financial freedom.

pros: Overall, working with the students is great and the team of coworkers is wonderful. This could be a great role for a young and hungry chef that wants to get established in Chicago. Great campus and really good participation in downtown Chicago culinary events like NRA and Chicago Gourmet.
cons: Hours of the job are very demanding with early mornings, late nights, and week-ends. Doing complex upscale service with inexperienced students that rotate in and out every 3 months makes progressive management and development very difficult.

review_title: Good environment, fun coworkers, and great students
pros: The diversity of the staff and students is by far one of the greatest assets of Kendall. I was only at Kendall for 1.5 years but I made friends that I will have for the rest of my life. The work was consistent, but not very challenging. The lunch plan is fantastic! When I was there it was a monthly fee that was taken out of your paycheck and allowed you to eat two meals a day in the student-run cafeteria.
cons: My pay was lower than the national average for the job I was doing. Overall, I don't have any negative comments about Kendall.

review_title: Great Opportunity to gain experience while in school!
job_title: Private Dining Server & Bartender in Chicago, IL
pros: The Events Department is a fantastic option for those who are studying either Hospitality or Culinary Arts at Kendall. The management works closely with the majority of professors and do not let work interfere with student worker's academic performance.
cons: Low pay rate is a major downside. If the amount of workers was cut by 33%, the labor could be reallocated to paying the hardest workers, instead of compensating all equally, regardless of skills set.

pros:
International, extremely, over 70%

Dress Code
cons: Rules are only enforced for a few, including dress code slacking.  Over the years I attended Kendall I felt as if professionalism, innovation, drive, and knowledge were becoming less and less important to new big screen televisions, press and other social media, and lounging furniture.

pros: The school works with students and schedules them around their classes.  Pay is decent and you get maximum hours allowed..
cons: The staff can be somewhat political and unfortunately it spills over to the students.

pros: The students were amazing! Some co-workers were engaged and served the students, others were narcissistic and only tried to advance themselves at the expense of the community.
cons: Laureate Education Inc ruined the noble institution.

pros: Free food sometimes but then they changed to 150$ a month
cons: No benefits, no secure for job, no advancement , really low pay

pros: Fast paced and learn a lot about the events/hospitality industry.
cons: Stressful, have to work with people from all over the world so language barrier can get frustrating.

job_title: Events Junior Sous Chef in Chicago, IL
pros: Accommodating managers, willing to work with student's schedules
cons: lack of organization in the kitchen, too much for one chef to handle

pros: schedule, opportunity for learning, work environment, opportunity for creativity, terrific staff
cons: Kendall is moving  from its Goose Island location later this year

pros: Great open encouraging place to work.
cons: Little out of the way, but that is what makes it a great campus.

pros: friendly, nice atmosphere, free lunches, nicest students and staff
cons: I can not think of any cons really

pros: Great Benefits at an affordable price.
